Stayed at Hotel Greenpark, JP Nagar and had a really pleasant experience. The rooms are clean, spacious, and well-maintained, making the stay very comfortable. The staff is polite, attentive, and always ready to help, which adds to the overall experience.

The highlight for me was the dining – the food is delicious, fresh, and surprisingly economical compared to other hotels. Great variety and quality at very reasonable prices.

Overall, a calm and welcoming place that truly gives value for money. Would definitely recommend it to anyone visiting Bangalore!

text.text:
Great rooms, terrible service at reception. Followup was ignored

The rooms were great. Spacious and clean, with great views of the city. The breakfast spread was also very nice. The stay was good and the restaurants seemed nice and the restaurant staff were very welcoming.

The check-in/front desk however, was not good.
We explicitly asked for 2 key cards and they gave us just one. A lady at the reception brushed me off quite rudely and insisted that she gave me 2 keycards. I had to get her boss involved and she was too arrogant to even acknowledge her mistake.

At check-out, I got my change in cash and another lady (different one from check-in) at the reception was quite condescending for some reason and decided by herself to shortchange me by 64 Rs. Its not a big amount, and I would have been fine with it, if she had only asked me first. It doesn't matter if its 1 rupee as well, it is only common courtesy to ask my permission first.

Overall, the hotel itself is nice but the reception staff damaged my experience a lot.

Edit (Aug/20): We reached out to the person who commented below on Aug/11 and there has been no reply yet. Just proves the point that the service here is terrible.
That decides it, never staying here again and would not recommend it to anyone either.

text.text:
Passing the parcel at Shangri-La!

I have stayed at Shangri-La multiple times before and always held it to a certain standard, but this visit was nothing short of a letdown. Right from check-in, the experience was marred by Gautam’s rude and unbothered attitude. When we reached the room, it reeked of a foul smell. On calling the service center, the first housekeeping staff walked in completely clueless and uninterested. His supervisor, Umesh, casually told me to “check with the front desk” if I wanted a room change something I never expected to hear at Shangri-La, where hospitality has always been seamless.

It only went further downhill. When Pavan came to assist us with moving bags to the other room, he literally made a face at us, banged the door, and walked away  a level of rudeness that was simply shocking for a brand like this. Breakfast was equally chaotic. All we asked for was a takeaway, only to be brushed off by a staff member who pointed us to another counter while standing in front of a whole stack himself.

At checkout, Laqshay didn’t bother to ask about our stay or invite feedback perhaps because they already know how poor the experience is. all we got was a flat, meaningless “sorry.”

Overall, this stay was charmless, careless, and a complete waste of time. For a brand built on warmth and world-class hospitality, Shangri-La has truly failed this time.

editorialSummary.text: Refined rooms & suites in a polished property with an outdoor pool, a spa & 3 restaurants.

text.text: Me and my family had a superb stay at Taj Bangalore during my layover in July'25, and I must say we enjoyed every moment of it. The property is pretty new and upholds a design philosophy which is a perfect blend of modernity and heritage. You can feel the legacy of Taj brand and heritage of Indian culture effortlessly weaving into this ultra-modded business hotel that meets all the needs of the modern world. The hotel  is an epitome of hospitality and luxury. The service provided by the hotel is simply praiseworthy. A highly professional staff dedicated to perfection and customer satisfaction. We got a traditional Indian welcome at the outset and a free upgrade to luxury room. Overall we had a very satisfying and memorable stay at Taj Bangalore and I would highly recommend it to all.😊

text.text:
Our recent family stay at the Taj was nothing short of magical. From the moment we stepped in, we were welcomed with warmth and genuine hospitality that made us feel right at home. Every detail — from the elegant ambiance to the impeccable service — reflected the care and excellence the Taj is known for.

What truly made this experience unforgettable were the thoughtful gestures from the staff that made our family feel special at every turn. Whether it was the personalized attention, the delightful surprises for the kids, or the carefully curated dining experiences, each moment was filled with joy, comfort, and a sense of gratitude.

We left with hearts full of beautiful memories — the kind that stay with you for a lifetime. A big thank you to the entire Taj team for creating such a delightful and soulful experience. We’re already looking forward to our next visit!

text.text:
We have had the privilege of hosting our parents 50th wedding anniversary at Novotel
Before I write a review I would like to personally thank from bottom of my heart the team of Novotel Sarthak, Akshita, Chef Devendra, Rajat for their immaculate service extended to us
Any client for any event would like to have a hassle free implementation of their event with expectations of excellence and I must say Akshita and Sarthak have delivered that to us. Being out of India and organising an event is a tough job but with their help at every point made my job much easier. They have extended help beyond their call of duty.
Chef Devendra has been instrumental in providing us with absolutely delicious food that all our guest raved about. His guidance and support for curated menu for our event has reflected in many praises from our guests. Thank you 🙏
Banquet manager Rajat has been absolutely wonderful in managing the banquet preparation and taking care of the needs of the guests and our requests
Once again I would recommend Novotel for any social events and I am truly thankful to the team for all their efforts to make our event a success
Thank you 🙏

The food at the hotel is genuinely good and probably the best part of the stay. However, the rest of the experience was Okay. The room provided was quite small and not worth the price.

The management was overly money-minded, constantly insisting on advance payments—even for bookings over two days—which felt unnecessary and pushy. On top of that, they have very rigid policies: guests are not allowed to visit, and outside food is strictly prohibited. These restrictions made the stay feel more like a controlled environment than a comfortable hotel experience.

Overall, I wouldn’t recommend this place unless you’re just going for a quick meal.

text.text:
recently stayed at JW Marriott in Bengaluru for a week with my leadership team for a business conference. While my overall stay and hospitality was warm and welcoming, there were some surprising lapses in service that I wouldn’t have expected from a brand of this caliber!!!

The highlights? The little touches that made me feel at home. Payal from JW Kitchen greeted me every morning with a warm smile and recognized my room number by my face. Athili, the lovely housekeeper, did a fresh flower décor on my bed each day and created the most soothing turndown tub service after long workdays. Dinesh from the concierge went above and beyond by bringing me medication when I wasn’t feeling well - even though I had only requested for a cup of cumin seeds. The AYS team was consistently responsive and polite. Laasya from Guest Relations made my day with a sweet JW note and treat for being a Bonvoy member. Sakthi from the wellness center took care of us with genuine kindness during facility maintenance. And Abhishek from housekeeping was always warm and engaging in our interactions!!

Other favorites from my stay included the fantastic breakfast spread, the well-equipped wellness center, pool, and gym, and the beautiful view of Cubbon Park from my room’s balcony. The smiling restaurant staff, who patiently served me without a single frown, truly elevated my experience, and I really appreciate each and everyone from the F&Brb team! They did a fabulous job!!!!

However, there were some aspects that fell short. One day, I returned to my room and found a small dead roach inside a paper bag of breakfast bread I had packed and accidentally left behind. While I can’t say for sure whether it came from the kitchen or the room, it was alarming. Housekeeping was inconsistent with some basic stuffs like one of the trash bins left uncleared, the kettle not cleaned for nearly five days, and essentials like water bottles and glasses were sometimes not restocked. I ignored these, thinking they were one-time misses, but it began to feel like a recurring pattern. At breakfast one day, my simple request for a one-egg cheese masala omelette with chicken sausages got messed up - twice!!!

One particularly disappointing experience was when I arranged a surprise room decoration for the son of our company’s COO (who was also staying there). I had clearly asked the GRM, Sanchita, to inform me once the guests had stepped out before starting the decoration - but she didn’t. The surprise was mishandled. Karan, the RDM, made a kind gesture to redo the setup in another room and added our gift, which I truly appreciated. However, neither he nor the original GRM followed up with me or met me afterward. Sanchita, in particular, didn’t acknowledge the oversight or offer a sincere apology, and I truly feel that she doesn't have the eye for detail that a GRM should have!!

Despite all this, I want to highlight that many team members were truly exceptional - their warmth, smiles, and willingness to go the extra mile made parts of my stay genuinely memorable. But at a JW Marriott, I do expect the basics to be non-negotiable: clean and well-serviced rooms, consistent housekeeping, and accurate attention to guest requests. That’s what defines luxury!!

I hope this feedback helps the team improve and better align guest experiences with the high standards JW is known for!

Would I return? Possibly yes - or maybe not!!! Only time can tell that!!

text.text: My recent stay at the Lemon Tree Hotel, Ulsoor, was unfortunately far from satisfactory and left much to be desired.Upon checking in, the immediate impression was the extremely cramped room size. Despite booking for two occupants, the room felt barely adequate for one, let alone two adults and a child. The "bed," if one could call it that, was laughably small – it seemed designed for a single person, making our stay incredibly uncomfortable and frustratingly restrictive for a family. Sleeping was a constant struggle, with little to no space for movement.Beyond the inadequate room, the noise levels were utterly unacceptable. Throughout the day, our stay was plagued by the incessant sounds of carpentry work emanating from within the hotel. This constant hammering, drilling, and sawing made it impossible to relax, work, or even have a quiet conversation. It completely disrupted any semblance of peace we hoped to find, turning the hotel into a construction zone rather than a place of rest.The combination of the claustrophobic room, the unbearable noise pollution, and the impractical bed size made our experience genuinely regrettable. What should have been a comfortable stay turned into a persistent source of irritation and discomfort. I would strongly advise against booking this hotel, especially if you are travelling with more than one person or a child, or if you value peace and quiet during your stay.

text.text:
*Review of Chancery Pavilion, Ashok Nagar, Bangalore*

We recently stayed at Chancery Pavilion for a 2-day business visit and had a wonderful experience overall. Here are the highlights:

- *Rooms*: Spacious and well-maintained, with comfortable beds. However, the pillow height could be improved.
- *Washrooms*: Clean and well-equipped, with excellent toiletries provided.
- *Breakfast*: The spread was excellent, with a wide range of South Indian and continental dishes. The service was excellent, and the food tasted fantastic.
- *Amenities*:
- *Gym*: Well-equipped with abundant workout equipment.
- *Meeting Rooms*: Spacious and suitable for business meetings.
- *Outdoor Catering*: Good quality and service.
- *Swimming Pool*: Excellent and well-maintained.

- *Amenities*:
- *Gym*: Well-equipped with abundant workout equipment.

- *Outdoor Catering*: Good quality and service.
- *Swimming Pool*: Excellent and well-maintained.
- *Room Service*: Unfortunately, it was not up to the mark, requiring multiple calls for even basic amenities.
- Alchemy bar at roof top was excellent choice, especially when sunsets.

Despite the room service issues, our overall stay was wonderful, and the hotel offered great value for the price. The food, amenities, and spacious rooms made it a great choice for our business visit.

Location is the highlight.. all locations at MG road, brigade, residency are easily accessible from On Time which helps you to be on time at any place in the heart of Bangalore.
Rooms are small but has all amenities - it's fine, considering the prime location that the place is.
The staff, service is excellent and they might be over doing a bit.

I asked for an iron box, went out for a stroll.. the room service just barged in with the master key and kept it in cupboard.. I was not informed.. I ended up waiting the rest of the day .. when finally before retiring for the day, decided to alert room service that iron box was not provided, only to hear that it was already kept inside.. I was a bit surprised as I was not expecting anyone to access my room.. the next day after breakfast while I was trying to iron my clothes couldn't locate the iron.. I was surprised and annoyed as again I was informed that the room service has taken the liberty to take if off as they believed in my promptness in attending to my ironing matters the yesternight and duly took the iron to another room!! I then had to wait till the room service took their sweet time to get me another one ... Heights of efficiency.. but at the cost of customers trust!

text.text:
Excellent Stay at The OnTime Hotel, Ashok Nagar, Bangalore

I had a wonderful experience staying at The OnTime Hotel in Ashok Nagar, Bangalore. The hotel's location is truly unbeatable — situated in the heart of the city with easy access to MG Road, the metro, and other key areas, making it incredibly convenient for both business and leisure travelers.

The staff at the hotel are exceptionally welcoming, cooperative, and always ready to assist with a humble attitude. Their warmth and professionalism made my stay even more enjoyable.

The food served at the hotel is simply superb — delicious, fresh, and satisfying. The hygiene standards maintained across the hotel, including the common areas, rooms, and restaurants, are top-notch and truly commendable.

Whether you're visiting for business, family, friends, or solo, this hotel caters to all needs comfortably. It is undoubtedly one of the best options within a 10 km radius of MG Road and Ashok Nagar.

My heartfelt congratulations to the management and staff for maintaining such high standards. Keep up the excellent work, and I look forward to staying here again!

text.text:
⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

I had the pleasure of staying at Four Seasons, Bangalore for 4 days and the experience was truly amazing. The staff is extremely well-trained, courteous, and reflects a culture built on strong values, which really enhances the overall guest experience.

The rooms are spacious, comfortable, and beautifully maintained. The front office team was very helpful and professional, while the kitchen team deserves special mention for the delightful dining experience — the breakfast spread was absolutely superb!

The hotel’s surroundings are wonderful, and its prime location makes it very convenient. I also loved the unique vertical structure with around 20 floors, offering smooth and seamless transitions across all services.

Overall, a fantastic stay and I’d highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Bangalore!

text.text:
Rooms and facilities seem opulent but beyond that this place is empty: the biggest downfall is the inexperienced staff and lackluster food scene.

While housekeeping staff really seemed to care about customers, the leadership team and front desk seem to be doing this as just a job, and don’t care about providing the best customer service. There is no passion or energy needed for the hotel business.

Front desk and restaurant staff need retraining on basic etiquette and how to respond to feedback. Their interactions are almost robotic. Would recommend staying at the Ritz Carlton or the Leela to learn what great service looks like!

We tried Cur8 for breakfast and dinner, and Far & East for dinner. Food at both places does not have taste or originality, and leaves nothing to be remembered. At Rs 8000 for an entree and appetizer, Far & East is a total joke. The service was a total failure as well. Check out Yataii in Shangri-La instead if you’re looking for great food and service.

We realized opulence and throwing money at the outside appearance and architecture alone like Four Seasons does, cannot buy great customer experience.

Don’t waste your money and time at the Four Seasons until they really value customer feedback and make some major changes to address these issues.

text.text:
I recently had the pleasure of dining at the Four Seasons Hotel Bangalore, and I must say, the experience was nothing short of exceptional. From the moment we arrived, the hospitality was warm and attentive—every staff member we interacted with went above and beyond to make us feel welcome and comfortable.

Dinner was an absolute delight. The ambiance of the restaurant was elegant yet relaxed, setting the perfect tone for a memorable evening. The menu offered a great variety of dishes, each prepared with the finest ingredients and presented beautifully. Every bite was full of flavor, and it was clear that the chefs take great pride in their craft.

What truly stood out was the impeccable service. The staff was knowledgeable, courteous, and genuinely passionate about creating a great experience. They anticipated our needs without being intrusive, which made the evening feel effortless and enjoyable.

Overall, the Four Seasons Hotel Bangalore delivers on every front—luxurious hospitality, exquisite dining, and a warm, inviting atmosphere. I look forward to returning soon and highly recommend it to anyone looking for a truly elevated experience.

text.text:
An underwhelming stay that just didn’t feel like a stay at a Marriott property. And as a lifetime gold elite, I would know.
Rooms are not maintained well. Things are broken, cracked, bathroom isn’t properly cleaned. Our TV set top box had to be changed pretty much as soon as we checked in. However, the technician came promptly and rectified the situation quickly. Wanted to have the Sunday brunch but were told the previous evening itself that nothing is available for some reason 😔 some drilling was going on somewhere. We requested a late checkout and the hotel extended that courtesy.

All in all, a less than satisfactory stay by Marriott standards.

Edit: after I posted the review I was contacted by the Asstt. Front Office Manager on how he could make it right. He felt that by “bribing” me with 2000 Bonvoy Points would make it right. I have asked them to reverse the credit but that has not been done.

editorialSummary.text: Contemporary hotel offering warm rooms, plus complimentary breakfast & a rooftop bar.

text.text:
I had a very pleasant stay at Ramada Encore by Wyndham Bangalore Domlur. The hotel is ideally located right on the main road, making it very convenient to access rental cabs and commute around the city. The surrounding area is clean and well-maintained, adding to the overall comfort of the location.

The room was excellent — spacious, well-designed, and equipped with all the amenities needed for a comfortable stay. Whether you're traveling solo, on business, or with family, the accommodation suits a variety of needs. Housekeeping was prompt and attentive, ensuring that the room remained in great condition throughout the stay.

One of the highlights was the buffet breakfast. The spread was impressive with a good variety of dishes that changed regularly, keeping things fresh and interesting for guests staying multiple days. The quality and taste of the food were consistently good.

Overall, Ramada Encore Domlur offers great value and comfort in a prime location. I’d highly recommend it for both short and extended stays.

Everything we needed was provided for - iron, hair dryer, bottled water, room slippers, a safe and sufficient closet space. We also ordered from the room service menu several times  and the food was great and very reasonably priced. All in all a fantastic stay and great value for money.

text.text:
Having stayed at this property a couple of years ago, I was disappointed to see how much it has deteriorated in terms of customer service and overall guest experience.

During check-in, my younger brother came to visit and as I was walking him to the elevator, no staff stopped us. However, once we were inside the elevator, a bell boy abruptly stuck his hand in to stop the door and demanded identification for “security reasons.” I understand the need for security, but the approach was unprofessional and made us uncomfortable.

It was raining heavily and I was traveling with my wife and infant, so I asked the front desk if they had an umbrella we could borrow. The response was curt and dismissive—they said umbrellas were only for staff to escort guests, not for guests themselves. Later, when I asked again while escorting my brother to his vehicle, they claimed a guest had taken the only umbrella to smoke outside. Hard to believe that a supposed 4-star hotel has just one umbrella for all its guests.

The rooms were clearly in decline—worn-out furniture, tired interiors, and generally not well-maintained.

The only redeeming factor was the food—the buffet breakfast and dinner were both delicious, with a wide variety and good quality.

Unfortunately, the poor service, lack of hospitality, and rundown facilities make this a place I won’t be returning to. A real letdown compared to my previous stay.

text.text: Being a 5 star property, I thought this place felt like a bit of a downgrade. The lobby appeared uninviting due to its dull lighting however the looming centerpiece statue was impressive. I booked a room with balcony however the view was of the back side of a building. I understand you can't get scenic views in a city however this balcony served me no purpose except for drying my socks. The bed was extremely comfortable and I had a good night's sleep so 5/5 on that. The bathroom had a tub which was a plus point. The breakfast spread had variety and the chef at the live counter prepared a very delicious omelet for me. I enjoyed my meal and would come back for it. The check in and check out process were quick and without any hassle.

Update - Worst! Worst! Not even worth 1 star.
I booked my stay for 4 days a studio with a balcony (as per Booking.com).

I requested an early check-in, but they couldn’t arrange it and instead asked me to pay ₹600 per hour × 4 hours = ₹2,400. When I finally entered the room, it was nothing like what was shown on the booking site extremely disappointing.- But your receptionist was not giving any other option rather than paying and why you wont give any other justification for my below comments ??

The internet connection was terrible. Even when connected, it kept disconnecting or had no access at all.

At checkout, I asked for an invoice. The receptionist said she was a little busy and would send it to me on WhatsApp. I agreed, thinking I was being polite, but that was my mistake. It has now been 2 weeks, and despite chasing them multiple times calling and following up I still haven’t received it. Every time, they say “shortly” but never actually send it.

When I checked in, I asked for the Wi-Fi password. The receptionist said she would send it on WhatsApp but after 3 hours of waiting, I had to go back to reception to get it myself.

The reception staff keep forgetting (or ignoring) your requests as soon as you walk away.

In the end, I will never recommend this property to anyone, and I will never come back.

text.text:
I had a truly wonderful experience during my stay at Green Park Hotel, Bangalore. From the moment I arrived, I was impressed by the immaculate cleanliness maintained throughout the property—from the lobby to the rooms, everything was spotless and well-kept.

The food spread deserves a special mention—diverse, delicious, and thoughtfully curated to cater to a wide range of tastes. Every meal was a treat, and the quality and presentation were consistently top-notch.

What truly made the stay memorable was the hospitality of the staff. Everyone I interacted with was courteous, professional, and always ready to help with a warm smile. Whether it was room service, housekeeping, or front desk support, the level of care and attention was exceptional.

Overall, Green Park Hotel offers a perfect blend of comfort, cleanliness, great food, and outstanding service. I highly recommend it to anyone visiting Bangalore, whether for business or leisure.

A special mention for the General Manager Mr Mahapatra who ensures that your stay is smooth and flawless and you are well taken care..... In one line - YOU ARE PAMPERED BEYOND IMAGINATION

Hotel Greenpark Bangalore is located in the heart of the city, making it easy to explore Bangalore's attractions. The hotel's modern amenities and excellent service made my stay comfortable and enjoyable.

The staff at Hotel Greenpark Bangalore went above and beyond to ensure my stay was memorable. From the front desk team to the housekeeping staff, everyone was friendly and helpful.

My room at Hotel Greenpark Bangalore was clean, spacious, and comfortable. The bed was cozy, and the bathroom was well-maintained.

The hotel's restaurant served delicious food with varied options. I enjoyed the breakfast spread, and the room service was prompt.

Considering the high quality of service, amenities, and location, I felt that Hotel Greenpark Bangalore offered excellent value for money.

I would definitely stay at Hotel Greenpark Bangalore again and recommend it to friends and family.

The hotel's modern amenities, including the rooftop pool and fitness center, were impressive and well-maintained.

The staff at Hotel Greenpark Bangalore were friendly, helpful, and responsive to needs.

10. Prime Location
The hotel's location in the heart of Bangalore city was perfect for exploring the city's attractions.

Rating: 5/5 stars

Thanks sanjana

text.text:
The Shangri-La Bengaluru is a luxurious hotel located in the heart of Bengaluru, India. Known for its elegance and top-notch service, it offers a wonderful experience for both business and leisure travelers.

One of the standout features of the hotel is its stunning architecture and design. The lobby is grand and exudes a sense of sophistication, while the rooms are spacious, tastefully decorated, and equipped with modern amenities. The hotel's attention to detail is evident in every aspect, from the beautifully appointed furnishings to the plush bedding.

The staff at Shangri-La Bengaluru is highly professional, courteous, and attentive. They go out of their way to ensure that guests have a comfortable stay and are always ready to assist with any requests or inquiries. The level of service provided is exceptional, making guests feel truly pampered and well taken care of.

Dining options at the hotel are diverse and impressive. The restaurants offer a wide range of cuisines, from local Indian delicacies to international dishes prepared by skilled chefs. The quality of food is outstanding, with an emphasis on using fresh ingredients and presenting dishes in an artful manner. The hotel also has a well-stocked bar where guests can enjoy a variety of drinks and cocktails.

The amenities at Shangri-La Bengaluru are excellent. The spa facilities are serene and provide a perfect retreat for relaxation and rejuvenation. The fitness center is well-equipped and caters to the needs of health-conscious guests. Additionally, the hotel has a beautiful outdoor swimming pool with a sun deck, allowing guests to unwind and soak up the sun.

The location of the hotel is another advantage. Situated in the upscale neighborhood of Malleshwaram, it offers easy access to popular attractions, shopping centers, and business districts in Bengaluru. The hotel also provides transportation services, making it convenient for guests to explore the city.

Overall, Shangri-La Bengaluru is a superb hotel that provides a memorable experience. From its luxurious accommodations and exceptional service to its excellent dining options and convenient location, it exceeds expectations in every aspect. Whether you're visiting Bengaluru for business or leisure, this hotel is sure to impress.

text.text:
I recently had the pleasure of staying at Taj Bangalore with my family from 18th to 22nd June, and it turned out to be one of the most memorable experiences of our lives. From the moment I booked our stay, the staff was exceptionally prompt, courteous, and attentive to every query. They patiently answered all our questions and ensured a seamless check-in process. I had requested an early check-in, and they graciously accommodated the request without hesitation.

Despite the hotel being just a short walk from the airport, we were warmly received with a chauffeur-driven car—a thoughtful gesture that set the tone for our stay. On arrival, we were greeted with a traditional tika and a warm welcome. The hotel’s décor was exquisite, and the ambiance felt truly luxurious.

Our room was stunning, offering breathtaking views of the airport and the thrill of watching flights take off. The thoughtful welcome gifts and goodies were a delightful touch. The food was simply divine—the buffet spread was extensive, catering generously to both vegetarian and non-vegetarian preferences.

We also made time to relax by the pool and enjoyed some wonderful live music performances during our stay. A stroll through the lush green gardens in Bangalore’s soothing weather was the perfect way to unwind.

Overall, I highly recommend Taj Bangalore for families seeking a luxurious and heartwarming experience. I’m already looking forward to returning soon!

text.text:
Stayed for a night at this beautiful and amazingly located place.
Right outside the airport, This hotel has got a great view...so much so that out of all the things my most favorite part was view I got from the room and the Hallway.

We booked a luxury Deluxe room, King size bed along with an extra bed..for 3 adults. The room was spacious, and the bathroom was equipped well along with a tub with a beautiful view. Our room was so beautiful located on the 4th floor..that we were able to see the views of T1 of Kempegwda Airport from room and T2 from the Hallway.
The room number was 446..just a headups if anyone books the same.

Coming to the food.
The dinning hall had great ambience. The taste of food was 4/5. The hospitality of the people was great. The Veg and Non veg countes were also kept separate which was really a good thing. The only place it lacked was in variety of food options. In the buffet, variety was quite less. The least from the other Taj properties I've visited. But the headchef came to us personally and asked for the feedback and gave some beverages on the house.

Amenities.
Swimming pool, gym, spa, kids zone, shops..didn't use them much but did go around those plays for some photography.

text.text:
I had a very disappointing experience at Lemon Tree Hotel, Whitefield, Bangalore. Given the brand’s reputation and the premium price I paid for my stay, I expected a seamless and professional experience. Unfortunately, from the moment I arrived, I was met with inefficiencies and poor customer service.

The onboarding process was frustrating, as their online portal was not functioning properly, leading to unnecessary delays in the registration process. Additionally, as an Australian citizen with an Overseas Citizenship of India (OCI), I am exempt from the Form C requirement, which applies only to non-OCI holders. However, the manager and staff were completely unaware of this. I had to spend 10 minutes explaining Indian immigration policies to them as they insisted on seeing an entry stamp in my passport—something that was neither required nor relevant.

To add to the inconvenience, just 15 minutes after checking in, hotel management knocked on my door asking for my passport again to make another copy. This was disruptive, unprofessional, and further highlighted the lack of coordination among the staff.

On top of all this, there was ongoing construction within the premises, right next to the dining area and restrooms. The dust and noise levels were unbearable, making the environment extremely uncomfortable. For a hotel of this stature, such conditions are unacceptable.

Within the first few minutes of my arrival, I was already regretting my choice. Lemon Tree needs to significantly improve its staff training, guest onboarding process, and overall service standards. I expected much better and hope they take this feedback seriously.

text.text:
J.W. Marriott Bangalore: A Pinnacle of Luxury and Hospitality

Situated in the heart of Bangalore, J.W. Marriott stands as an epitome of luxury and excellence in the hospitality industry. With its world-class amenities, impeccable service, and stunning architecture, it is undeniably one of the best hotels in the city. This essay aims to shed light on the aspects that make J.W. Marriott Bangalore a standout choice for travelers seeking an unforgettable stay.

It offers Unparalleled Accommodation:
J.W. Marriott Bangalore offers a plethora of luxurious accommodations, ranging from spacious rooms to exquisite suites. Every room is meticulously designed, combining contemporary elegance with opulence. The stunning views of the city skyline add to the charm, allowing guests to indulge in a truly immersive experience. The hotel's attention to detail ensures that guests are provided with the utmost comfort and convenience throughout their stay.

2. Culinary Delights:
J.W. Marriott Bangalore takes pride in its diverse and exceptional culinary offerings. The hotel boasts a range of restaurants, each offering a unique dining experience. From authentic Indian cuisine at Spice Terrace to international delights at JW Kitchen, guests are treated to a gastronomic journey that tantalizes the taste buds. The hotel's commitment to sourcing fresh, local ingredients ensures that every meal is a delightful experience.

3. World-Class Amenities:
J.W. Marriott Bangalore leaves no stone unturned when it comes to providing top-notch amenities. The hotel features a state-of-the-art fitness center, a rejuvenating spa, and a stunning rooftop pool with panoramic views of the city. Additionally, the hotel offers ample event and meeting spaces with cutting-edge technology, making it an ideal choice for corporate gatherings and special occasions.

4. Impeccable Service:
The hallmark of J.W. Marriott Bangalore is its impeccable service. The staff is trained to anticipate and cater to every guest's need, ensuring a personalized experience that exceeds expectations. Whether it is arranging transportation, organizing memorable excursions, or attending to any special requests, the dedicated team is committed to providing a seamless and unforgettable stay.

5. Prime Location:
J.W. Marriott Bangalore enjoys a prime location in the heart of the city, making it easily accessible to business districts, shopping hubs, and tourist attractions. Its proximity to major transportation links ensures that guests can effortlessly explore all that Bangalore has to offer. Whether one is visiting for business or leisure, the hotel's central location proves to be a significant advantage.

Conclusion:
J.W. Marriott Bangalore stands as a testament to the finest hospitality in the city. Its luxurious accommodations, exceptional dining options, world-class amenities, and impeccable service make it one of the best hotels in Bangalore. Setting new standards in luxury and comfort, J.W. Marriott Bangalore promises an unforgettable experience for all its guests, leaving them with cherished memories and a desire to return.

text.text: The Air France flight for my father and I got cancelled and we were frustrated, hungry, exhausted - and my father needed his rest asap, as he's a recovering stroke patient and the airline had us all standing for hours to await a flight they knew they were going to cancel. This hotel was a safe haven, a comfortable stay and the food was delivered directly from heaven. They provide nice toiletries, in case you've forgotten yours. They have clean and hygienic bathtubs! The sheets and linens were perfectly clean. In India, the only other places I've stayed that were comparable were in Chandigarh and Delhi. Worldwide, Riviera Maya -- and much more expensive with food that wouldn't compare! We weren't happy upon arrival because we were so tired and Air France had royally screwed the entire flight they cancelled, but this hotel stay took the sting off such a terrible experience! Thank you so much, it was truly a pleasure staying in your hotel!

Fabulous Four Seasons Bangalore.
From the minute one enters the hotel, to check in, to the room and the common areas..everything is well designed and the service is top notch..

The pool area and the deck overlooking the pool were fantastic. The landscaping of the hotel show the richness of the Bangalore landscape with all the trees.

The location is ideal for the airport, but can be tricky to get into the city during rush hours.

The Asian restaurant and bar on the top floor are a must-visit.

Were it not for its location, the Four Seasons would have beaten The Oberoi as our favourite hotel in Bangalore.

Will be back for sure.

text.text:
The Four Seasons Hotel Bengaluru is a haven of luxury and sophistication in the heart of the city. Nestled within the lush Embassy ONE complex, the hotel exudes modern elegance while maintaining a warm and inviting atmosphere. From the moment you step into the grand lobby, you are greeted by impeccable design and serene greenery that creates an oasis-like ambience. The rooms are a masterpiece of comfort and style, featuring floor-to-ceiling windows with stunning views, plush bedding, marble bathrooms, and high-tech amenities that cater to every need.

Dining at the hotel is an experience in itself. CUR8, the all-day dining restaurant, offers a delectable range of international and Indian cuisines, with live cooking stations adding a touch of theatrical charm. For a more sophisticated affair, the Asian-inspired dining options and the poolside bar serve as perfect venues to unwind. The staff’s attention to detail and personalized service ensure that every guest feels valued and pampered. Whether you're here for a business trip or a leisurely retreat, the Four Seasons Bengaluru effortlessly combines luxury, comfort, and world-class hospitality to create an unforgettable stay.

The staff’s attention to detail and personalized service ensure that every guest feels valued and pampered. Whether you're here for a business trip or a leisurely retreat, the Four Seasons Bengaluru effortlessly combines luxury, comfort, and world-class hospitality to create an unforgettable stay.

text.text:
Four Seasons Hotel Bangalore

I recently had the pleasure of staying at Four Seasons Hotel Bangalore, and it was an experience that truly lived up to the brand’s reputation for luxury and hospitality.

From the moment I arrived, the warm and attentive service stood out. The check-in process was seamless, and the staff made sure every request was handled with care. The room was elegantly designed, with plush bedding, modern amenities, and a breathtaking view of the city skyline. It was the perfect blend of comfort and sophistication.

The dining options were exceptional. The breakfast spread at CUR8 was diverse and delicious, featuring fresh, high-quality ingredients. I also had the chance to dine at Far & East, which offered an exquisite selection of Asian delicacies with impeccable presentation.

The pool and spa facilities added to the relaxation factor. The infinity pool was serene, and the spa treatments were rejuvenating, making it an ideal retreat after a long day.

The only minor drawback was that service at peak hours, especially in the restaurants, could be a tad slow. However, the staff’s professionalism and courteous nature made up for it.

Overall, Four Seasons Bangalore is an outstanding choice for a luxurious stay in the city. I highly recommend it for both business and leisure travelers. Looking forward to my next visit!

⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️✨ (4.5/5)

text.text: Stayed at this hotel for a few days with family. Absolutely top-notch service, very courteous staff especially Ayaz Naushad who's handling Guest Relations. The hotel is quite nicely managed, very accommodating for any special requests which made the experience very satisfying. Being in Brigade Road, the hotel's proximity to the commercial district is quite helpful for quick shopping sprees and access to restaurants. The rooms are not very large but reminiscent of hotels with higher star ratings in terms of quality and neatness with all the necessary amenities. Breakfast is on the roof-top alongside the pool where you can enjoy the beautiful Bangalore weather as well. Food is also excellent! They have Chef Pillai cuisine in-house where business lunches/dinners can happen! Don't forget to try Fish Nirvana there! All in all a wonderful experience and would recommend this hotel in a heartbeat! 👍🏽👍🏽

text.text:
I stayed there for about two months so I may have seen things others haven't in a shorter amount of time.

Pros:
-The hotel looks very nice. They have a stunning lobby with glass doors and windows which is where I spent most of my time sitting on the couches reading the newspaper, working on my laptop or browsing on my phone.
-The breakfast buffet was delicious. Lots of variety and food was tasty. The breakfast team treats you with respect and makes you feel like you're at home.
-The night manager, Sairam, was a pleasure to speak with. He was friendly, courteous, professional and shared good tips for someone who isn't familiar with the city.
-The rooms were clean and spacious and most importantly, they have an ethernet port. This was crucial for me as I would work during the weekday and I needed a strong and consistent internet connection to make video calls. Having the ethernet port made working easier.

Cons:
- The wifi policy was silly. The policy was each room is only allowed 2 connections for the wifi and if you needed additional connections then they would provide you with a 24 hour connection (With data transfer constraints). So since I was staying with another guest and we each had 2 phones and 2 laptops, I would constantly ask for multiple 24 hour passwords almost every day. I asked for the hotel to make an exception but they said unfortunately that's their policy and nothing could be done. On my last day, I spoke to Managing Partner Mr. Shakeer and mentioned my wifi issue and he said they do make exceptions. If that was the case, then it was poorly communicated to the staff as I asked multiple times if something could be done.
- Their gym is very sad. I wouldn't even call it a gym but rather a "Cardio Room" so people don't have a misunderstanding of what to expect. This wasn't too much of a big deal because I was always out and about but it would have been nice to lift some free weights.
- After a couple months of stay, I noticed that their was a clog being developed in my standing shower that caused water to drain very slow which caused temporary flooding.
-Mr. Santoush, one of the managers at the hotel is the most introvert manager I have ever met. During my 2 months staying at the hotel, he never once said hello to me. He would just walk by and act like I wasn't there. Even on my last day, as I was speaking to Mr. Shakeer, he was literally right there and never said a word or even thanked me for my stay. One of the pillars in the hospitality and tourism industry is customer service and this was definitely missing from him.

Overall, the cons are minor compared to the pros and I would stay at the hotel again if I came back.

text.text: The Park Bangalore is India's first ever-contemporary boutique hotel. This stylishly designed hotel has made its mark in the hospitality business and has featured in Tatler magazine's list of best 101 hotels in the world. The hotel is located on MG Road and offers ideal accessibility to the city's business and leisure areas. The state-of-the-art amenities provided by the hotel further adds to the comfort of the entire experience. The Park Bangalore also has a compelling range of restaurant and bar facilities. Monsoon, the 24-hour restaurant, serves exquisite International and Indian fare. Italia is considered as one of the best Italian restaurants in the country and has bagged several awards to its name. The i-Bar offers an envious range of imported liquor brands while the Aqua, a unique alfresco, pool-side lounge offers the perfect ambiance to settle down after a grueling day's work. All in all the Park Bangalore offers a holistic experience. One of the first boutique hotels in Bangalore located at Mahatma Gandhi Road exudes sophistication and intimacy. Home to extravagance - THE Park Bangalore is a place to relax your senses and pamper yourself with the best Bangalore has to offer. It promises complete indulgence with its facilities, restaurants and bars - making it a preferred destination of business travelers looking for restful hotel in the city.Every minute detail at THE Park Bangalor accentuates the unique and modern styling, meticulously crafted by Conran & Partners. The hotel provides an elevated standard of style, contemporary design and decor. Each floor is decorated to embody various landscapes, experiences, lifestyles and cultures from across India.State-of-the-art technology and amenities for commerce, leisure and relaxation makes THE Park Bangalore an ideal choice for guests for business, leisure or a weekend retreat. The Park Hotel located on Mahatma Gandhi Road, the heart of the city promises the best for travelers looking for luxury hotels in Bangalore.

text.text:
My stay at Spektrum Hotel Bengaluru Airport was excellent.

Rooms and Cleanliness (5/5): The rooms, bathrooms, and beddings were spotless with meticulous attention to detail. The fresh, pleasant fragrance throughout created a relaxing ambiance.

Hospitality and Gestures (5/5): The staff, led by Mr. Sasi, were warm, polite, and genuinely welcoming. Their dedication made me feel truly valued—better than many 5-star experiences I’ve had.

Food and Breakfast (5/5): The breakfast was thoughtfully prepared. The South Indian delicacies, especially dosas and vadas were delicious and of top quality.

Final Thoughts: The hotel’s team and attention to detail made my stay seamless and memorable. Its convenient airport location and peaceful environment make it a top choice. Highly recommended!
